responses.question_text: Do you have ISO 27001 certification?
responses.answer_text: Yes, GlobalBank Limited maintains ISO 27001:2013 certification across all global operations. We undergo annual surveillance audits by Lloyd's Register, with most recent certification renewal in January 2024.
responses.evidence: ISO 27001 Certificate GB-ISO-27001-2024

responses.question_text: What is your SOC 2 compliance status?
responses.answer_text: GlobalBank maintains SOC 2 Type II compliance with semi-annual audits by Deloitte covering all five Trust Service Criteria. Additionally, we maintain SOC 1 Type II for financial controls.
responses.evidence: SOC 2 Type II Report FY2024 & SOC 1 Type II Report FY2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle GDPR compliance?
responses.answer_text: As a financial institution operating in EU, we maintain strict GDPR compliance overseen by our EU Data Protection Officer. We have implemented privacy by design across all systems and maintain detailed Records of Processing Activities (RoPA).
responses.evidence: GDPR Compliance Certification & EU Representative Appointment

responses.question_text: What encryption standards do you use?
responses.answer_text: GlobalBank uses AES-256 encryption for data at rest and TLS 1.3 for data in transit. All cryptographic modules are FIPS 140-2 Level 3 validated. We comply with PCI DSS encryption requirements for payment card data.
responses.evidence: Cryptographic Controls Standard CCS-GB-001

responses.question_text: Do you support multi-factor authentication?
responses.answer_text: Yes, MFA is mandatory for all user access using hardware tokens (RSA SecurID), mobile authenticators (Duo), and biometric authentication. Customer-facing systems support FIDO2 authentication.
responses.evidence: Authentication & Authorization Framework AAF-2024

responses.question_text: What is your data backup frequency?
responses.answer_text: Financial transaction data has real-time replication to secondary data center. Full backups occur every 6 hours with transaction log backups every 15 minutes. Backup retention is 7 years to meet financial regulations.
responses.evidence: Backup & Business Continuity Policy BBCP-2024

responses.question_text: How often do you conduct penetration testing?
responses.answer_text: GlobalBank conducts quarterly penetration testing by Big Four audit firm and monthly vulnerability assessments. Internet-facing banking applications undergo continuous security testing. All critical findings must be remediated within 14 days.
responses.evidence: Penetration Test Report Q3-2024 - Deloitte

responses.question_text: What is your incident response time?
responses.answer_text: Our Global Security Operations Center operates 24/7/365 across three time zones with 5-minute response time for critical security incidents and 15-minute response for high-severity incidents impacting customer data or financial transactions.
responses.evidence: Security Incident Response SLA GSOC-SLA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a Business Continuity Plan?
responses.answer_text: Yes, our BCP meets regulatory requirements with RTO of 2 hours for critical banking functions and RPO of zero for financial transactions via synchronous replication. BCP is tested quarterly with results reported to board and regulators.
responses.evidence: Business Continuity Plan - Regulated Version 2024

responses.question_text: What is your data retention policy?
responses.answer_text: Financial transaction records are retained for 7 years per regulatory requirements (Basel, GDPR, local banking regulations). Customer PII is retained per contract plus regulatory period. Secure deletion follows certified processes.
responses.evidence: Records Retention Schedule RRS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage access control?
responses.answer_text: Access control implements segregation of duties (SoD), dual authorization for sensitive operations, role-based access with approval workflows, and quarterly access certification by data owners. All access is logged for audit.
responses.evidence: Access Control & Segregation of Duties Policy ACS-2024

responses.question_text: What security training do employees receive?
responses.answer_text: All employees complete mandatory annual security and financial crime awareness training. Banking staff complete additional AML/KYC training. Developers complete secure coding training. Compliance is tracked and reported to regulators.
responses.evidence: Security Training & Awareness Program 2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a vulnerability management program?
responses.answer_text: Yes, continuous vulnerability scanning with critical vulnerabilities patched within 24 hours, high within 48 hours per regulatory requirements. Vulnerability metrics are reported monthly to Risk Committee.
responses.evidence: Vulnerability Management Framework VMF-GB-2024

responses.question_text: What antivirus/endpoint protection do you use?
responses.answer_text: All endpoints run SentinelOne EDR with behavioral AI, exploit prevention, and automated threat hunting. Additional financial malware protection is deployed on transaction processing systems.
responses.evidence: Endpoint Protection Architecture EPA-2024

responses.question_text: How do you secure your network?
responses.answer_text: Network security employs defense-in-depth with Palo Alto firewalls, IPS, DDoS mitigation, network segmentation per PCI DSS requirements, dedicated payment network zone, and monitoring of all financial transaction traffic.
responses.evidence: Network Security Architecture - PCI DSS Compliant v3.0

responses.question_text: Do you perform background checks on employees?
responses.answer_text: All employees undergo extensive background screening including criminal history (7 years), credit check, employment verification, education verification, and reference checks. Employees with financial system access undergo enhanced screening.
responses.evidence: Pre-Employment Screening Policy - Financial Services

responses.question_text: What is your password policy?
responses.answer_text: Passwords require minimum 14 characters with complexity. Password expiration is 60 days for privileged accounts, 90 days for standard users. Passwords checked against breach databases. Password managers are provided to all staff.
responses.evidence: Credential Management Policy CMP-GB-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure software development lifecycle?
responses.answer_text: Yes, our SDLC includes threat modeling, secure design reviews, static/dynamic code analysis, dependency scanning, penetration testing, and security sign-off before production. SDLC aligns with BSIMM framework.
responses.evidence: Secure Development Lifecycle SDL-v4.0

responses.question_text: How do you handle data breaches?
responses.answer_text: Data breach response includes immediate containment, forensic investigation, regulatory notification (within 72 hours per GDPR, immediate for financial regulators), customer notification, and regulatory reporting. Legal and PR are involved in all communications.
responses.evidence: Data Breach Response Plan - Regulatory Edition 2024

responses.question_text: What cloud providers do you use?
responses.answer_text: GlobalBank uses AWS GovCloud and Azure Government Cloud for non-core banking systems. Core banking remains on-premises in certified data centers. Cloud usage requires regulatory approval and data sovereignty compliance.
responses.evidence: Cloud Strategy & Governance Framework 2024

responses.question_text: Do you encrypt data in transit?
responses.answer_text: All data in transit uses TLS 1.3 with bank-grade cipher suites. Financial transaction data uses additional encryption layers. Legacy protocol support (TLS 1.2 and below) is disabled. Certificate pinning is used for mobile apps.
responses.evidence: Transport Encryption Standard TES-2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage third-party vendor risk?
responses.answer_text: All vendors undergo due diligence including financial stability, security assessment, regulatory compliance review, and on-site audits for critical vendors. Vendor risk is reviewed quarterly and reported to board.
responses.evidence: Third-Party Risk Management - Banking Regulatory Framework

responses.question_text: What is your change management process?
responses.answer_text: Changes follow strict CAB process with segregation of duties between development, testing, and production. All production changes require dual approval. Emergency changes have expedited process with post-implementation audit.
responses.evidence: Change & Release Management Policy CRM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a DDoS mitigation strategy?
responses.answer_text: Yes, multi-layered DDoS protection via Arbor Networks and Akamai can mitigate attacks exceeding 1 Tbps. Banking services have dedicated DDoS protection with sub-second detection and mitigation.
responses.evidence: DDoS Mitigation & Response Plan 2024

responses.question_text: How do you monitor system logs?
responses.answer_text: All logs centralized in Splunk Enterprise Security with real-time correlation, fraud detection rules, regulatory reporting capabilities, and 7-year retention. Logs are immutable and tamper-evident per audit requirements.
responses.evidence: Security Information & Event Management Policy SIEM-2024

responses.question_text: What is your disaster recovery plan?
responses.answer_text: DR includes active-active data centers with synchronous replication for core banking, RTO of 1 hour, RPO of zero for financial transactions. DR is tested semi-annually with independent validation by external auditors.
responses.evidence: Disaster Recovery Plan - Regulatory Tested & Certified 2024

responses.question_text: Do you segregate customer data?
responses.answer_text: Customer data is segregated by geography (EU, US, APAC) with separate databases, encryption keys, and admin access per data residency regulations. Cross-border data transfer has specific controls and documentation.
responses.evidence: Data Segregation & Residency Architecture 2024

responses.question_text: What database encryption do you use?
responses.answer_text: All databases use Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) with AES-256. Encryption keys stored in FIPS 140-2 Level 3 HSMs with dual control and split knowledge. Key rotation occurs annually with documented procedures.
responses.evidence: Database Encryption & Key Management Standard DEKS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security patches?
responses.answer_text: Critical security patches for internet-facing systems within 24 hours, internal systems within 48 hours. Patch testing in non-prod environment is mandatory. Patch compliance reported to Risk Committee monthly.
responses.evidence: Patch & Vulnerability Management Policy PVMP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have cyber insurance?
responses.answer_text: Yes, GlobalBank maintains $50M cyber liability insurance through Lloyd's of London covering business interruption, data breach, regulatory fines, and reputational harm. Policy renewed annually with risk assessment.
responses.evidence: Cyber Insurance Certificate - Lloyd's Policy #GB-CYB-2024

responses.question_text: What compliance frameworks do you follow?
responses.answer_text: We comply with Basel III, PCI DSS Level 1, ISO 27001, SOC 1/SOC 2, GDPR, PSD2, GLBA, FFIEC guidelines, and local banking regulations in 45 countries of operation.
responses.evidence: Regulatory Compliance Matrix - Global Banking 2024

responses.question_text: How do you protect against ransomware?
responses.answer_text: Ransomware protection includes immutable backups (NetApp SnapLock), advanced email filtering, EDR with ransomware-specific detection, application whitelisting on financial systems, network segmentation, and quarterly ransomware simulations.
responses.evidence: Ransomware Defense Program RDP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you perform code reviews?
responses.answer_text: All code changes require mandatory peer review with at least two approvals. Financial transaction code requires security architect review. Code review metrics tracked include coverage, defect density, and security findings.
responses.evidence: Secure Code Review Standard SCRS-v3.0

responses.question_text: What is your data classification policy?
responses.answer_text: Data classified as Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted, and Regulatory. Financial data and PII are Restricted with encryption, access logging, and DLP monitoring required. Classification labels are automated.
responses.evidence: Data Classification & Handling Policy DCHP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure API security?
responses.answer_text: APIs use OAuth 2.0 with mTLS for partner integrations, API gateway with rate limiting, input validation, PCI DSS compliance for payment APIs, and comprehensive logging. Open Banking APIs comply with PSD2 requirements.
responses.evidence: API Security Framework - PSD2 & PCI Compliant v2.0

responses.question_text: Do you have a bug bounty program?
responses.answer_text: Yes, GlobalBank operates a private bug bounty via YesWeHack with rewards up to $50,000 for critical vulnerabilities. Financial transaction vulnerabilities have elevated rewards. Program results reviewed quarterly by security committee.
responses.evidence: Responsible Disclosure & Bug Bounty Program Policy

responses.question_text: What email security measures do you use?
responses.answer_text: Email security includes Mimecast for advanced threat protection, SPF/DKIM/DMARC enforcement, email encryption for sensitive communications, DLP policies, and mandatory S/MIME for executive communications.
responses.evidence: Email Security & Data Loss Prevention Policy ESP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle cryptographic key management?
responses.answer_text: Cryptographic keys managed in Thales Luna HSMs (FIPS 140-2 Level 3) with dual control, split knowledge, and M-of-N key recovery. Key ceremonies are documented and witnessed. Keys rotated annually minimum.
responses.evidence: Cryptographic Key Management - Banking Grade CKM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have physical security controls?
responses.answer_text: Data centers meet Tier III+ standards with 24/7 armed security, biometric + PIN access, mantraps, CCTV with 90-day retention, and security audit trails. Physical security audited semi-annually.
responses.evidence: Physical Security Standards - Financial Data Centers PSS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your mobile device security policy?
responses.answer_text: All mobile devices managed via MobileIron with containerization, remote wipe, jailbreak/root detection, app whitelisting, and prohibited app blocking. Mobile banking apps use certificate pinning and biometric authentication.
responses.evidence: Mobile Device & Application Security Policy MDAS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you secure container deployments?
responses.answer_text: Container security (limited use in banking) includes signed images, vulnerability scanning, runtime protection via Sysdig, secrets in HashiCorp Vault, and network policies. Containers not used for core banking functions.
responses.evidence: Container Security Guidelines - Non-Core Systems CSG-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security incident escalation process?
responses.answer_text: Incidents categorized as Critical (customer financial impact), High (security breach), Medium (compliance), Low (informational) with defined escalation to CISO, CRO, CEO, and regulators based on severity and impact thresholds.
responses.evidence: Security Incident Classification & Escalation Matrix SICEM-2024

responses.question_text: What data loss prevention measures do you have?
responses.answer_text: DLP deployed across email (Mimecast), endpoints (Forcepoint), web (proxy), and cloud (CASB). Policies prevent exfiltration of customer PII, payment card data, and confidential financial information. Violations trigger security review.
responses.evidence: Data Loss Prevention Program DLPP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure secure remote access?
responses.answer_text: Remote access requires Citrix Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) with MFA, no data persistence on endpoint, session recording for privileged users, and geographic access restrictions. Split-tunneling prohibited.
responses.evidence: Remote Access Security Standard - Financial Services RASS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security audit frequency?
responses.answer_text: Annual external audits (SOC 1/2, PCI DSS, ISO 27001), semi-annual regulatory examinations, quarterly internal security audits, and monthly compliance assessments. All audit findings tracked with executive oversight.
responses.evidence: Audit & Examination Calendar 2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage privileged access?
responses.answer_text: Privileged access managed via CyberArk PAM with password vaulting, session recording (10-year retention), dual authorization for production database access, just-in-time provisioning, and break-glass procedures for emergencies.
responses.evidence: Privileged Access Management - Banking Controls PAM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure code repository?
responses.answer_text: Code in GitHub Enterprise with required reviews, branch protection, commit signing, secrets scanning, and audit logging. Access follows least privilege. Financial transaction code has additional access restrictions.
responses.evidence: Source Code Management Security Policy SCMS-2024

responses.question_text: What threat intelligence do you use?
responses.answer_text: Threat intelligence from FS-ISAC, SWIFT, FBI IC3, Recorded Future, and Mandiant. Intelligence integrated into SIEM, firewalls, and IPS for automated blocking. Weekly threat briefings for security team.
responses.evidence: Threat Intelligence Program - Financial Services TIP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security exceptions?
responses.answer_text: Security exceptions require risk assessment, compensating controls, CRO approval (CISO for elevated risk), time limitation (maximum 90 days), and board notification for material risks. All exceptions audited.
responses.evidence: Security Exception & Risk Acceptance Policy SERAP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you perform security metrics tracking?
responses.answer_text: We track 75+ security KPIs reported to board quarterly including: security incidents, patch compliance, vulnerability metrics, audit findings, fraud losses, phishing click rates, and regulatory examination results.
responses.evidence: Security & Risk Metrics Dashboard - Board Reporting Q3-2024

responses.question_text: What is your data anonymization approach?
responses.answer_text: Production data in non-prod environments uses tokenization via Delphix, synthetic data generation for testing, data masking for PII, and differential privacy for analytics. Anonymization validated by privacy team.
responses.evidence: Data Anonymization & Test Data Management Policy DATDM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you secure APIs at the network level?
responses.answer_text: APIs accessible only via API gateway (Apigee) with IP whitelisting, geo-blocking, rate limiting per partner, DDoS protection, and WAF with financial services rulesets. Payment APIs on dedicated network segment.
responses.evidence: API Network Security Architecture ANSA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have asset inventory management?
responses.answer_text: Comprehensive asset inventory in ServiceNow CMDB with automated discovery, network access control for unauthorized devices, asset classification, EOL tracking, and quarterly reconciliation. Inventory audited annually.
responses.evidence: Asset Management & Inventory Policy AMIP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to secrets management?
responses.answer_text: Secrets stored in HashiCorp Vault (banking-grade configuration) with dynamic secret generation, automatic rotation, audit logging, and access policies. Hard-coded secrets prevented via automated scanning and git hooks.
responses.evidence: Secrets & Credential Management Framework SCMF-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure supply chain security?
responses.answer_text: Supply chain security includes vendor security assessments, SBOM requirements, code signing verification, dependency scanning (Snyk), vendor concentration risk analysis, and supply chain incident response plans.
responses.evidence: Software Supply Chain Risk Management SSCRM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security champion program?
responses.answer_text: Yes, security champions in each business unit receive advanced training, participate in threat modeling, conduct security design reviews, and serve as security liaisons. Champions meet monthly with security team.
responses.evidence: Security Champion Network Program v3.0

responses.question_text: What is your approach to zero trust?
responses.answer_text: Zero trust initiative includes identity-centric access, continuous verification, micro-segmentation, least privilege, assume breach posture, and device trust. Multi-year roadmap with quarterly milestones and regulatory alignment.
responses.evidence: Zero Trust Architecture Roadmap - Banking Implementation 2024-2026

responses.question_text: How do you handle secure deletion?
responses.answer_text: Data deletion follows NIST SP 800-88 R1 with cryptographic erasure for encrypted data, overwrite for magnetic media, and physical destruction by certified vendors. Deletion certificates retained for audit. Process meets regulatory requirements.
responses.evidence: Secure Data Disposal Procedures - Regulatory Compliant SDDP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security awareness for executives?
responses.answer_text: Executives receive quarterly security briefings covering cyber threats to financial sector, social engineering targeting executives, incident simulations, and regulatory developments. Board receives annual cyber risk deep dive.
responses.evidence: Executive & Board Security Education Program 2024

responses.question_text: What is your cloud security posture management?
responses.answer_text: Limited cloud usage monitored via Prisma Cloud with CIS benchmark compliance, automated remediation for critical issues, configuration monitoring, and integration with change management. Cloud security reviewed monthly.
responses.evidence: Cloud Security Governance Framework CSGF-2024

responses.question_text: How do you perform security architecture reviews?
responses.answer_text: All projects undergo security architecture review at design phase including threat modeling (STRIDE), data flow analysis, trust boundary identification, and regulatory compliance assessment. Financial systems require additional review.
responses.evidence: Security Architecture Review Process - Financial Services SARP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a red team program?
responses.answer_text: Annual red team exercises simulate nation-state level attacks against banking infrastructure including ATM networks, wire transfer systems, and customer data. Exercises validated by regulators and inform security investments.
responses.evidence: Red Team Exercise Report 2024 - Financial Infrastructure

responses.question_text: What is your approach to database activity monitoring?
responses.answer_text: Imperva DAM deployed on all production databases with real-time monitoring, privileged user tracking, SQL injection prevention, compliance reporting (PCI, SOX), and automated alerting for suspicious queries.
responses.evidence: Database Activity Monitoring - Financial Data Protection DAM-2024

responses.question_text: How do you manage security debt?
responses.answer_text: Security debt tracked in Jira with risk scoring, aging analysis, and quarterly review by CRO/CISO. Critical security debt escalated to board. Security work allocated 20% of each sprint with separate budget for remediation.
responses.evidence: Security Technical Debt Management Framework STDMF-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have insider threat detection?
responses.answer_text: Insider threat program includes UEBA via Exabeam, privileged user monitoring, financial transaction anomaly detection, after-hours access alerts, HR integration for at-risk employees, and behavioral indicators of compromise.
responses.evidence: Insider Threat Detection & Prevention Program ITDPP-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security testing coverage?
responses.answer_text: 100% code coverage for SAST, all internet-facing apps undergo annual penetration testing, payment systems tested quarterly, infrastructure pentested bi-annually, and continuous vulnerability scanning. Testing meets regulatory requirements.
responses.evidence: Security Testing Standards & Coverage Report 2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure compliance in CI/CD?
responses.answer_text: CI/CD includes automated security gates: SAST (Checkmarx), dependency scanning (Snyk), secrets detection, compliance checks (PCI, SOX), and security approvals required for production deployment. Failed checks block pipeline.
responses.evidence: Secure CI/CD Pipeline Standards - Banking SCDPS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure configuration baseline?
responses.answer_text: All systems follow CIS benchmarks and PCI DSS hardening guides. Configuration compliance monitored via Qualys Policy Compliance. Deviations require exception approval. Baseline reviewed annually and after major incidents.
responses.evidence: Secure Configuration Baselines - Financial Services SCB-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to API versioning security?
responses.answer_text: API versions supported for minimum 18 months after deprecation notice. Security patches backported to supported versions. Legacy API sunset requires customer migration plan and regulatory notification for payment APIs.
responses.evidence: API Lifecycle & Deprecation Policy - PSD2 Compliant ALDP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for mergers and acquisitions?
responses.answer_text: M&A due diligence includes technical security assessment, regulatory compliance review, data protection analysis, penetration testing of target, and 12-month integration security roadmap. Material risks disclosed to board and regulators.
responses.evidence: M&A Security Due Diligence Playbook - Banking Sector v2.0

responses.question_text: Do you have security orchestration and automation?
responses.answer_text: Splunk Phantom SOAR automates incident response, threat enrichment, phishing analysis, and remediation workflows. 70% of security alerts automated. Automation tested monthly and includes fraud detection playbooks.
responses.evidence: Security Orchestration & Automation Strategy SOAS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to security in DevOps?
responses.answer_text: DevSecOps with security champions in teams, automated testing in pipelines, security as code, infrastructure scanning, container security, and security metrics in team dashboards. Security participates in sprint planning.
responses.evidence: DevSecOps Implementation Framework - Financial Services v1.5

responses.question_text: How do you manage security for SaaS applications?
responses.answer_text: SaaS apps require security assessment, SSO integration, data residency verification, DPA signing, and monitoring via Netskope CASB. Financial data prohibited in unapproved SaaS. Quarterly access reviews mandatory.
responses.evidence: SaaS Security & Third-Party Cloud Policy SSTPC-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have network segmentation?
responses.answer_text: Network segmented per PCI DSS requirements: cardholder data environment isolated, separate zones for DMZ/internal/management/development, inter-zone firewalls, and micro-segmentation for critical financial systems.
responses.evidence: Network Segmentation Architecture - PCI DSS Compliant NSA-2024

responses.question_text: What is your certificate management process?
responses.answer_text: Certificates managed via Venafi with automated renewal 60 days before expiry, certificate pinning for mobile apps, extended validation certs for customer-facing sites, and 24/7 monitoring. Expired certificates trigger P1 incident.
responses.evidence: PKI & Certificate Management Policy - Banking Grade PCMP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure security in machine learning models?
responses.answer_text: ML models (fraud detection, credit risk) undergo adversarial testing, model validation, explainability requirements, data privacy controls, model governance, and regulatory compliance review before production deployment.
responses.evidence: ML Model Risk Management Framework - Financial Services MLMRMF-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security governance framework?
responses.answer_text: Security governance includes quarterly board cyber risk reporting, annual strategy review with regulators, Three Lines of Defense model, dedicated Risk Committee, and defined escalation to board for material risks.
responses.evidence: Cybersecurity Governance Framework - Banking Regulatory Edition 2024

responses.question_text: What is your data residency and sovereignty approach?
responses.answer_text: Customer data stored in country of origin per banking regulations (EU, US, UK, APAC data centers). Cross-border transfers require legal basis, SCCs, and regulatory approval. Data residency audited annually.
responses.evidence: Data Residency & Sovereignty Policy - Global Banking DRSP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for IoT devices?
responses.answer_text: IoT devices (limited to facility management) isolated on separate VLAN, certificate authentication, encrypted communications only, regular firmware updates, and monitoring. IoT not used for banking operations.
responses.evidence: IoT Security Standards - Non-Banking Systems IOSS-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have quantum-safe cryptography plans?
responses.answer_text: We are participating in industry quantum cryptography working groups, monitoring NIST PQC standards, and have multi-year roadmap for quantum-safe algorithm adoption by 2027. Crypto-agility built into architecture.
responses.evidence: Quantum Computing Risk & Readiness Assessment QCRRA-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security incident lessons learned process?
responses.answer_text: All security incidents undergo post-incident review within 3 business days with root cause analysis, timeline, lessons learned, regulatory notifications assessment, and remediation action items tracked to closure. Results shared with regulators.
responses.evidence: Post-Incident Review & Lessons Learned Process PIRLP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure secure software dependencies?
responses.answer_text: Dependencies scanned via Snyk with policy enforcement, vulnerability monitoring, automated PRs for updates, approved package lists, private mirrors for vetted packages, and quarterly dependency security reviews.
responses.evidence: Software Dependency Security Management SDSM-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security metrics for executives?
responses.answer_text: Executive dashboard includes: cybersecurity maturity score, regulatory compliance status, audit findings, fraud losses, incident metrics, third-party risk scores, security spending, and peer benchmarking.
responses.evidence: Executive Cybersecurity Dashboard - Board & Regulatory Reporting Q3-2024

responses.question_text: What is your approach to security in infrastructure as code?
responses.answer_text: IaC scanned via Checkov and Terraform Sentinel, policy as code enforcement, peer review required, compliance checks (PCI, SOX), immutable infrastructure, and GitOps with audit trails for all changes.
responses.evidence: Infrastructure as Code Security Standards IACSS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle data subject access requests?
responses.answer_text: DSAR managed via OneTrust platform with 30-day SLA, automated data discovery across 50+ systems, data portability, secure data deletion with verification, and audit trail for regulatory compliance.
responses.evidence: DSAR & Data Subject Rights Management Procedures DSRMP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security requirements for contractors?
responses.answer_text: Contractors undergo enhanced background screening (financial institutions requirements), complete security training, use separate contractor accounts, require NDA signing, and are offboarded within 4 hours of contract end.
responses.evidence: Contractor & Third-Party Personnel Security Policy CTPPS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security testing for APIs?
responses.answer_text: API testing includes OWASP API Top 10, authentication bypass testing, authorization testing, rate limiting verification, input fuzzing, business logic testing, and PCI DSS requirements for payment APIs. Testing quarterly minimum.
responses.evidence: API Security Testing Procedures - PSD2 & PCI Compliant ASTP-2024

responses.question_text: How do you ensure security in microservices?
responses.answer_text: Microservices (limited use) include service mesh for mTLS, API gateway authentication, distributed tracing, secrets injection via Vault, network policies, and least privilege per service. Not used for core banking.
responses.evidence: Microservices Security Architecture - Non-Core Banking MSA-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have a security research program?
responses.answer_text: Our Financial Sector Security Research team collaborates with FS-ISAC, publishes threat research specific to banking, and maintains relationships with law enforcement. Research informs defensive strategies and regulatory engagement.
responses.evidence: Security Research & Threat Intelligence Contributions 2024

responses.question_text: What is your employee offboarding security process?
responses.answer_text: Offboarding includes immediate account deactivation, access revocation within 30 minutes, device recovery, knowledge transfer, exit interview covering confidentiality and regulatory obligations, and 90-day monitoring of access attempts.
responses.evidence: Employee Offboarding Security Checklist - Financial Services v2.0

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for remote workers?
responses.answer_text: Remote work requires bank-issued laptops with EDR, Citrix VDI for accessing customer data, MFA, home network security guidance, webcam covers for privacy, and quarterly device security audits.
responses.evidence: Remote Work Security Policy - Financial Services RWSP-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security requirements in vendor contracts?
responses.answer_text: Vendor contracts include security schedules with encryption requirements, data handling, breach notification (24 hours), annual SOC 2 reports, audit rights, insurance requirements ($10M minimum), and termination for security breaches.
responses.evidence: Vendor Contract Security Requirements - Financial Services Template

responses.question_text: What is your security approach for blockchain/distributed ledger?
responses.answer_text: We are piloting blockchain for trade finance with security controls including: permissioned blockchain, node security hardening, smart contract audits by third parties, key management in HSMs, and regulatory compliance assessment.
responses.evidence: Blockchain Security Framework - Trade Finance Pilot BSF-2024

responses.question_text: How do you measure security culture?
responses.answer_text: Security culture measured via quarterly surveys, phishing simulation results (target <5% click rate), security awareness completion rates, security finding submission, and culture assessment by external consultants annually.
responses.evidence: Security Culture Assessment & Metrics Q3-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have security playbooks for common scenarios?
responses.answer_text: We maintain 40+ security playbooks including: ransomware, DDoS, wire fraud, payment card breach, account takeover, ATM attacks, insider trading, market manipulation detection, and regulatory breach notification.
responses.evidence: Security Incident Response Playbook Library - Financial Services v5.0

responses.question_text: What is your security budget and resource allocation?
responses.answer_text: Security budget is 12% of IT budget ($150M annually) with 10% YoY growth. Allocation: 35% personnel (120 FTE), 40% technology, 15% external services, 10% training. CISO reports to CRO with direct board access.
responses.evidence: Cybersecurity Budget & Resource Plan 2024 - Board Approved

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for acquisitions of other companies' data?
responses.answer_text: Acquired data undergoes classification, encryption implementation, access control setup, PII mapping, regulatory compliance verification, data quality assessment, and integration into retention/disposal schedules within 120 days.
responses.evidence: M&A Data Security Integration Procedures MDASI-2024

responses.question_text: Do you have environmental security controls in data centers?
responses.answer_text: Data centers have FM-200 fire suppression, N+2 HVAC redundancy, 2N UPS and generator power, water leak detection, seismic bracing, environmental monitoring (temperature/humidity), and annual environmental security audits.
responses.evidence: Data Center Environmental & Physical Security Standards DCEPS-2024

responses.question_text: What is your security approach for APIs consumed from third parties?
responses.answer_text: Third-party APIs undergo security assessment, use mTLS authentication, credentials in Vault, TLS-only communication, circuit breakers, rate limit handling, availability monitoring, and annual security re-assessment.
responses.evidence: Third-Party API Integration Security Standards - Banking TPAISS-2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle security in your incident communications?
responses.answer_text: Incident communications use approved templates, legal/compliance review, encrypted channels (Signal for internal), press release approval by CEO/Board for material incidents, regulatory notification protocols, and customer notification per regulatory timeframes.
responses.evidence: Incident Communication & Regulatory Notification Plan - Financial Services ICRNP-2024
